body.p: On the other hand, some believe that point‑of‑sale costs should be deducted in a fair value model. They believe that the carrying amount of an asset should represent the economic benefits that are expected to flow from the asset. They argue that fair value less estimated point‑of‑sale costs would represent the markets’ estimate of the economic benefits that are expected to flow to the entity from that asset at the balance sheet date. They also argue that failure to deduct estimated point‑of‑sale costs could result in a loss being deferred until a sale occurs.
